Speak up for a 2019-2021 budget that works for everyone!
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

ACLU members around the state have been working to shape the Wisconsin budget into something that works for all of us. We’ve been talking to our legislators about incarcerating fewer people, and using the money saved to invest in things that build our communities, like public education.

The Wisconsin Public Education Network has been a strong partner in this work, and they believe the current version of the budget doesn't even come close to meeting the urgent needs of our kids, and further widens the gaps between "have" and "have nots." They are marching 60 miles to Madison beginning on June 22 to demand equitable funding for Wisconsin’s kids. They would love for ACLU members to join them for a mile, at a whistle stop along the way, or especially for the final two-mile home stretch from Madison East High School to the Capitol on Tuesday, June 25.

The Joint Finance Committee is reviewing the budget right now and will send a draft to the governor in the next few weeks. They haven’t gotten the message, because last Tuesday, June 11, the commitee approved $5 million to buy land on which to build a new prison. Now is the time to say we must invest wisely in our state’s future. To spend less on mass incarceration and more on public education, because we need to be investing in PEOPLE, not prisons.

To find out more about the March to Madison, visit the Wisconsin Public Education Network's Facebook page.

Thank you for your continued support of our work.

Sincerely,

Emilio De Torre
Director of Community Engagement, ACLU of Wisconsin
